text: Thomas Paulsley "Sleepy" LaBeef (né LaBeff; July 20, 1935 – December 26, 2019) was an American rockabilly singer-songwriter, guitarist and actor. He was born in Smackover, Arkansas. His first hit was 1968's "Every Day", which peaked at No. 73 on the U.S. Billboard Country charts.[ Billboard Singles], Allmusic.com After moving to Plantation Records in 1969, he scored a second hit in 1971 with "Blackland Farmer", which charted at No. 67. LaBeef also starred in the horror movie The Exotic Ones. He was more popular in Europe.[ Sleepy LaBeef] at Allmusic LaBeef died on December 26, 2019 in Siloam Springs, Arkansas at the age of 84.Sleepy LaBeef, Enduring Rockabilly Cult Hero, Dies at 84 ==References== ==Other websites== * Listing of all Sleepy's songs and alternatives Category:1935 births Category:2019 deaths Category:American rock singers Category:American rock guitarists Category:American singer-songwriters Category:American gospel singers Category:American gospel musicians Category:American blues singers Category:American blues musicians Category:American movie actors Category:Actors from Arkansas Category:Musicians from Arkansas Category:Singers from Arkansas Category:Writers from Arkansas
title: Sleepy LaBeef
